TITLE: Subscribing to Foreign States in ioBroker Adapters
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to handle errors when subscribing to all states of an adapter. This is used to catch and log subscription errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/classes/AdapterClass.md#2025-04-21_snippet_105

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
function (err) {
  if (err) adapter.log.error('Cannot subscribe object: ' + err);
}
```

TITLE: Installing ioBroker on Debian-based Systems
DESCRIPTION: This bash command downloads and executes the ioBroker installation script on Debian-based systems. It provides a quick way to set up ioBroker.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -sLf https://iobroker.net/install.sh | bash -
```

TITLE: Creating an ioBroker Object Structure
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the structure of an object that can be created with setObject(). It demonstrates the required fields common, native, and type, with specific attributes needed for a state object including name, type, and role.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/classes/AdapterClass.md#2025-04-21_snippet_94

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
{
    common: {
         name: 'object name',
         type: 'number', // string, boolean, object, mixed, array
         role: 'value'   // see https://github.com/ioBroker/ioBroker/blob/master/doc/SCHEMA.md#state-commonrole
    },
    native: {},
    type: 'state' // channel, device
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Custom Install Logic in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to implement custom installation logic for an adapter by using the 'install' event. This allows interaction with ioBroker databases during the installation process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
this.on('install', () => {
    this.log.info('Performing installation logic ...')
    // Perform your installation logic
});
```

TITLE: Retrieving States with getStates in ioBroker Adapter (JavaScript)
DESCRIPTION: Function to read all states of the current adapter according to a pattern. Returns an object with state IDs as keys and state objects as values. The example demonstrates reading all states using a wildcard pattern.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/classes/AdapterClass.md#2025-04-21_snippet_61

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
adapter.getStates('*', function (err, states) {
    for (var id in states) {
         adapter.log.debug('"' + id + '" = "' + states[id].val);
    }
});
```

LANGUAGE: javascript

```
...
}
```

TITLE: Setting Foreign States Asynchronously in ioBroker
DESCRIPTION: Sets a state value in the states DB for any instance. This asynchronous method returns a promise that resolves when the operation is complete.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/classes/AdapterClass.md#2025-04-21_snippet_82


TITLE: Setting State Value Format Example in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Example object structure for setting a state value with optional attributes including value, acknowledgment flag, timestamps, quality, origin, comment, expiration, and last changed time.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/classes/AdapterClass.md#2025-04-21_snippet_80

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{
    val:    value,
    ack:    true|false,       // default - false; is command(false) or status(true)
    ts:     timestampMS,      // default - now
    q:      qualityAsNumber,  // default - 0 (ok)
    from:   origin,           // default - this adapter
    c:      comment,          // default - empty
    expire: expireInSeconds   // default - 0
    lc:     timestampMS       // default - automatic calculation
}
```

TITLE: Error and Change Handling for setStateChanged in ioBroker
DESCRIPTION: Example callback function to handle errors and detect changes when using setStateChanged. The callback receives any error, the ID of the state, and a notChanged flag indicating whether the value was actually changed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/classes/AdapterClass.md#2025-04-21_snippet_102

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
function (err, id, notChanged) {
  if (err) adapter.log.error('Cannot set value for "' + id + '": ' + err);
  if (!notChanged) adapter.log.debug('Value was changed');
}
```

TITLE: Defining StateCommon Interface in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: The `StateCommon` interface extends the `ObjectCommon` and includes properties for defining the characteristics of states in ioBroker. It allows setting aliases, smart names, custom settings, and history attributes. The interface provides flexibility in configuring states, defining default values, and making them conditional based on other states. This code is dependent on TypeScript and requires the type definitions located in `types-dev/objects.d.ts`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/-internal-/interfaces/StateCommon.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```

interface StateCommon extends ObjectCommon {
    alias?: Record<string, any>;
    color?: string;
    custom?: Record<string, any>;
    def?: any;
    defAck?: boolean;
    desc?: StringOrTranslated;
    dontDelete?: true;
    expert?: true;
    habpanel?: any;
    history?: any;
    icon?: string;
    material?: any;
    max?: number;
    min?: number;
    mobile?: any;
    name: StringOrTranslated;
    read: boolean;
    role: string;
    smartName?: null | string | false | object & object;
    states?: string | string[] | Record<string, string>;
    step?: number;
    type: CommonType;
    unit?: string;
    workingID?: string;
    write: boolean;
}

```

TITLE: Retrieving Objects with Pattern and Enums
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to get objects matching a pattern with specific type and enum resolution. Returns object data including common properties, native data and enum assignments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/classes/AdapterClass.md#2025-04-21_snippet_51

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
adapter.getForeignObjects('hm-rega.0.*', 'state', ['rooms', 'functions'], function (err, objs) {
  if (err) adapter.log.error('Cannot get object: ' + err);
  // objs look like:
  // {
  //    "hm-rega.0.ABC0000.1.STATE": {
  //        common: {...},
  //        native: {},
  //        type: 'state',
  //        enums: {
  //           'enums.rooms.livingroom': 'Living room',
  //           'enums.functions.light': 'Light'
  //       }
  //    },
  //    "hm-rega.0.ABC0000.2.STATE": {
  //        common: {...},
  //        native: {},
  //        type: 'state',
  //        enums: {
  //           'enums.rooms.sleepingroom': 'Sleeping room',
  //           'enums.functions.window': 'Windows'
  //       }
  //    }
}
```

TITLE: Reading Directories with readDir() in ioBroker
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to read the content of a directory from the DB for a given adapter and path. The function returns an array of files and directories with their metadata including stats, access control list, and timestamps.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/classes/AdapterClass.md#2025-04-21_snippet_67

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
adapter.readDir('vis-2.0', '/main/', function (err, filesOrDirs) {
  // All enums
  if (err) adapter.log.error('Cannot read directory: ' + err);
  if (filesOrDirs) {
     for (var f = 0; f < filesOrDirs.length; f++) {
        adapter.log.debug('Directory main has the following files and dirs: ' + filesOrDirs[f].file + '[dir - ' + filesOrDirs[f].isDir + ']');
     }
 }
});
```

TITLE: Configuring tsconfig.json for ioBroker Types

TITLE: Defining InstanceCommon TypeScript Interface
DESCRIPTION: Interface definition that extends AdapterCommon and specifies configuration properties for ioBroker instances. Includes properties for admin UI, operation modes, security, and runtime behavior.

```
interface InstanceCommon extends AdapterCommon {
    adminColumns?: string | (string | CustomAdminColumn)[];
    adminTab?: {
        "fa-icon"?: string;
        icon?: string;
        ignoreConfigUpdate?: boolean;
        link?: string;
        name?: StringOrTranslated;
        order?: number;
        singleton?: boolean;
    };
    adminUI?: AdminUi;
    allowInit?: boolean;
    automaticUpgrade?: AutoUpgradePolicy;
    availableModes?: InstanceMode[];
    blockedVersions?: string[];
    blockly?: boolean;
    color?: string;
    compact?: boolean;
    compactGroup?: number;
    connectionType?: ConnectionType;
    custom?: undefined;
    dataFolder?: string;
    dataSource?: "push" | "poll" | "assumption";
    dependencies?: Dependencies;
    desc?: StringOrTranslated;
    docs?: Partial<Record<Languages, string | string[]>>;
    dontDelete?: true;
    enabled: boolean;
}
```

TITLE: Define Adapter Properties in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet declares various optional and required properties for configuring ioBroker adapter instances. It includes settings like memory limits, runtime parameters, and administrative options. These properties facilitate the customization and management of adapters in the ioBroker environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/-internal-/interfaces/InstanceCommon.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: TypeScript
CODE:
```
/* Example TypeScript properties for an ioBroker adapter */
export interface AdapterCommon {
    materializeTab?: boolean; // Whether the admin tab is materialized. Required for Admin 3+
    memoryLimitMB?: number; // Optional memory limit for the instance
    messagebox?: true; // Deprecated in favor of supportedMessages in controller v5
    messages?: MessageRule[]; // Conditional messages by upgrade or installation
    mode: InstanceMode; // When and how an instance should be started
    name: string; // Name of the adapter excluding 'ioBroker.' prefix
    news?: { [version: string]: Translated }; // News per version for localization
    noConfig?: true; // Denotes absence of configuration dialog
    nodeProcessParams?: string[]; // Arguments for the adapter process, disabling compact mode
    nogit?: true; // Denotes manual GitHub installation isn\'t possible
    noIntro?: true; // Instances not shown in admin overview, useful for icons
    nondeletable?: true; // Adapter cannot be manually deleted or updated
    noRepository?: true; // Indicates absence in official ioBroker repositories
    onlyWWW?: boolean; // Whether the adapter only contains HTML files
    os?: 'linux' | 'darwin' | 'win32' | ('linux' | 'darwin' | 'win32')[]; // Supported OSes
    osDependencies?: {
        darwin: string[]; // Dependencies for OSX
        linux: string[]; // Dependencies for Linux
        win32: string[]; // Dependencies for Windows
    }; // Native dependencies for adapters
    platform: 'Javascript/Node.js'; // Platform specification
    plugins?: { [pluginName: string]: Record<string, any> }; // Plugins like Sentry
    preserveSettings?: string | string[]; // Attributes in instance not to be deleted
    readme?: string; // URL of the ReadMe file
    restartAdapters?: string[]; // Adapters to restart after install or update
    restartSchedule?: string; // CRON to restart daemon adapters
    role?: string; // Role of the object
    runAsCompactMode?: boolean; // If compact mode is active
}
```

TITLE: Object View Callback Implementation
DESCRIPTION: Example callback function for processing object view results. Shows how to iterate through returned document rows and handle empty results or errors.

```
function (err, doc) {
    if (doc && doc.rows) {
         for (var i = 0; i < doc.rows.length; i++) {
             var id  = doc.rows[i].id;
              var obj = doc.rows[i].value;
              adapter.log.info('Found ' + id + ': ' + JSON.stringify(obj));
         }
                 if (!doc.rows.length) adapter.log.info('No objects found.');
     } else {
         adapter.log.info('No objects found: ' + err);
     }
}
```

TITLE: Defining Command Permissions Object in JavaScript

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
var commandsPermissions = {
   getObject:          {type: 'object',    operation: 'read'},
   getObjects:         {type: 'object',    operation: 'list'},
   getObjectView:      {type: 'object',    operation: 'list'},
   setObject:          {type: 'object',    operation: 'write'},
   subscribeObjects:   {type: 'object',    operation: 'read'},
   unsubscribeObjects: {type: 'object',    operation: 'read'},
   subscribeFiles:     {type: 'object',    operation: 'read'},
   unsubscribeFiles:   {type: 'object',    operation: 'read'},

   getStates:          {type: 'state',     operation: 'list'},
   getState:           {type: 'state',     operation: 'read'},
   setState:           {type: 'state',     operation: 'write'},
   getStateHistory:    {type: 'state',     operation: 'read'},
   subscribe:          {type: 'state',     operation: 'read'},
   unsubscribe:        {type: 'state',     operation: 'read'},
   getVersion:         {type: '',          operation: ''},

   httpGet:            {type: 'other',     operation: 'http'},
   sendTo:             {type: 'other',     operation: 'sendto'},
   sendToHost:         {type: 'other',     operation: 'sendto'},

   readFile:           {type: 'file',      operation: 'read'},
   readFile64:         {type: 'file',      operation: 'read'},
   writeFile:          {type: 'file',      operation: 'write'},
   writeFile64:        {type: 'file',      operation: 'write'},
   unlink:             {type: 'file',      operation: 'delete'},
   rename:             {type: 'file',      operation: 'write'},
   mkdir:              {type: 'file',      operation: 'write'},
   readDir:            {type: 'file',      operation: 'list'},
   chmodFile:          {type: 'file',      operation: 'write'},
   chownFile:          {type: 'file',      operation: 'write'},

   authEnabled:        {type: '',          operation: ''},
   disconnect:         {type: '',          operation: ''},
   listPermissions:    {type: '',          operation: ''},
   getUserPermissions: {type: 'object',    operation: 'read'}
};
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  ...
  "log": {
    ...
    "transport": {
      ...
      "syslog1": {
        "type": "syslog",
        "enabled": false,
        "host": "localhost",
        "host_comment": "The host running syslogd, defaults to localhost.",
        "port_comment": "The port on the host that syslog is running on, defaults to syslogd's default port(514/UDP).",
        "protocol": "udp4",
        "protocol_comment": "The network protocol to log over (e.g. tcp4, udp4, unix, unix-connect, etc).",
        "path_comment": "The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e. /dev/log or /var/run/syslog for OS X).",
        "facility_comment": "Syslog facility to use (Default: local0).",
        "localhost": "iobroker",
        "localhost_comment": "Host to indicate that log messages are coming from (Default: localhost).",
        "sysLogType_comment": "The type of the syslog protocol to use (Default: BSD).",
        "app_name_comment": "The name of the application (Default: process.title).",
        "eol_comment": "The end of line character to be added to the end of the message (Default: Message without modifications)."
      }
    }
  }
  ...
}
```

TITLE: Defining State Quality Enumeration in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Enumeration defining state quality values for ioBroker states. It maps numeric values to specific quality states including good/bad status, connection problems, device errors, and substitute values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/-internal-/enumerations/STATE_QUALITY.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
enum STATE_QUALITY {
    GOOD = 0,                            // The default value for a state
    BAD = 1,                             // General problem
    CONNECTION_PROBLEM = 2,              // The instance cannot establish a connection
    SUBSTITUTE_FROM_CONTROLLER = 16,     // Substitute value from controller. Do not set this in adapters
    SUBSTITUTE_INITIAL_VALUE = 32,       // Quality for default values
    SUBSTITUTE_DEVICE_INSTANCE_VALUE = 64, // Substitute value from instance or device
    SUBSTITUTE_SENSOR_VALUE = 128,       // Substitute value from a sensor
    GENERAL_INSTANCE_PROBLEM = 17,       // General problem by instance
    GENERAL_DEVICE_PROBLEM = 65,         // General problem by device
    GENERAL_SENSOR_PROBLEM = 129,        // General problem by sensor
    INSTANCE_NOT_CONNECTED = 18,         // The instance is not connected
    DEVICE_NOT_CONNECTED = 66,           // The device is not connected
    SENSOR_NOT_CONNECTED = 130,          // The sensor is not connected
    DEVICE_ERROR_REPORT = 68,            // The device has reported an error
    SENSOR_ERROR_REPORT = 132            // The sensor has reported an error
}
```

TITLE: Object List Callback Implementation
DESCRIPTION: Example callback function showing how to process object list results. Demonstrates iterating through returned rows and handling errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/classes/AdapterClass.md#2025-04-21_snippet_56

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
function (err, res) {
    if (res && res.rows) {
         for (var i = 0; i < res.rows.length; i++) {
             var id  = res.rows[i].id;
             var obj = res.rows[i].value;
             adapter.log.info('Found ' + id + ': ' + JSON.stringify(obj));
         }
         if (!res.rows.length) adapter.log.info('No objects found.');
    } else {
        adapter.log.info('No objects found: ' + err);
    }
}
```

Each property is properly documented with types and inheritance information from the DatabaseOptions interface.

```
interface ObjectsDatabaseOptions extends DatabaseOptions {
    /**
     * type: string
     * Inherited from DatabaseOptions.type
     */
    type: string;
    /**
     * backup: DatabaseBackupOptions
     * Inherited from DatabaseOptions.backup
     */
    backup: DatabaseBackupOptions;
    /**
     * connectTimeout: number
     * Inherited from DatabaseOptions.connectTimeout
     */
    connectTimeout: number;
    /**
     * dataDir: string
     * Inherited from DatabaseOptions.dataDir
     */
    dataDir: string;
    /**
     * host: string
     * Inherited from DatabaseOptions.host
     */
    host: string;
    /**
     * jsonlOptions: JsonlOptions
     * Inherited from DatabaseOptions.jsonlOptions
     */
    jsonlOptions: JsonlOptions;
    /**
     * noFileCache: boolean
     */
    noFileCache: boolean;
    /**
     * options: object with various database connection options
     */
    options: {
        auth_pass: string;
        db: number;
        family: number;
        retry_max_count: number;
        retry_max_delay: number;
        /**
         * Optional tls: object
         */
        tls?: {
            ca?: string;
            cert?: string;
            key?: string;
            rejectUnauthorized?: boolean;
        };
    };
    /**
     * port: number
     * Inherited from DatabaseOptions.port
     */
    port: number;
    /**
     * type: 'file' | 'jsonl' | 'redis'
     */
    type: 'file' | 'jsonl' | 'redis';

     * writeFileInterval: number

     */
    writeFileInterval: number;
}
```

TITLE: Defining ReadDirResult Interface in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: The ReadDirResult interface defines the structure of the results returned from a directory read operation in TypeScript. It includes properties for storing access control lists (acl), timestamps for creation and modification, the file name, a flag indicating whether the entry is a directory, and partial file system statistics. Each property is defined with its type and optional status, helping developers ensure proper data handling in file system operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/-internal-/interfaces/ReadDirResult.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: TypeScript
CODE:
```
interface ReadDirResult {
  acl?: EvaluatedFileACL;  // Access rights
  createdAt?: number;      // Date of creation
  file: string;            // Name of the file or directory
  isDir: boolean;          // Whether this is a directory or a file
  modifiedAt?: number;     // Date of last modification
  stats: Partial<Stats>;   // File system stats
}
```

TITLE: Defining Server Response Interface for Controller Upgrade in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Defines the interface for the server response during the controller upgrade process. It includes properties for the upgrade status, stderr and stdout logs, and success indicator.

TITLE: Changing File Ownership in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Function to update file owner and group. Takes adapter name, file path, options object with owner and ownerGroup, and a callback function. Returns processed files with new ownership.
SOURCE: https://github.com/iobroker/iobroker.js-controller/blob/master/packages/controller/doc/classes/AdapterClass.md#2025-04-21_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
adapter.chownFile('vis-2.0', '/main/vis-views.json', {owner: 'newOwner', ownerGroup: 'newgroup'}, function (err, processed) {
  if (err) adapter.log.error('Cannot read file: ' + err);
  adapter.log.info('New files: ' + JSON.stringify(processed));
});
```
